messageBody:
System properties is one way, but don't let that stop you from passing
command line parameters. In your main method (which is static, remember),
just take all the parameters and assign them to static member variables.
They are then available to all your methods, and not just setup.

So I agree that a change isn't necessary, but I thought this would be a way
to have command line arguments, which Vishal seemed pretty interested in.
Just suggesting an alternative.

-Larry

On Fri, 27 Sep 2002 06:17:21 -0400, vbatra@adeptia wrote:

>Hi all,
>
>I remember some one asking if we can pass arguments from command line to a
>JUnit test

That you can already do with defining system-parameters

java -DmyParam=myValue junit.textui.TestRunner

In your Testcase you can access the value with
System.getProperty("myParam");

No need to change anything in JUnit.


Regards, Lothar
